data.text:
BEASLEY BRDCST : 7/11/2011 : Augusta's Only Radio Staff Me...

July 11, 2011 at 04:55 pm EDT

By

NEWS ANNOUNCEMENT JULY 11, 2011FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

Contact: Kent Dunn

VP / Market Manager Beasley Broadcast Augusta

(706) 396-7000 / kent.dunn@bbgi.comSTEVE SMITH JOINS WGAC AM/FM BECOMING AUGUSTA’S ONLY FULL-TIME RADIO STAFF METEOROLOGIST

AUGUSTA, Georgia, July 11, 2011 – Veteran Augusta broadcaster and current morning show co- host for Kicks 99 WKXC-FM, Steve Smith, has expanded his day to include duties as the area’s only full-time Radio staff meteorologist for sister-stations WGAC News Talk Radio 580 AM and 93.1 FM.

WGAC News Talk Radio, now in its 70th year on-air in the Augusta community, is the area’s top- ranked news/talk radio station, has the largest radio news staff in the CRSA and has been honored as the Georgia Association of Broadcasters “Station of the Year” for 10 consecutive years. In addition to his new weather duties, Smith will continue to kick off mornings for Augusta’s country music fans as part of the Kicks Wakeup Crew. Steve has been in broadcasting for nearly 30 years, beginning as a sports director for WBNO-FM in Bryan, Ohio. In 1984, he arrived in the Augusta market, reporting on news, sports and weather for both radio and TV, including a stint as a weekend weather anchor on WRDW-TV. He holds a B.A. in Broadcast Journalism from Georgia State University and a Certificate of Broadcast Meteorology from Mississippi State University. Beasley Broadcast Augusta’s Vice President and Market Manager, Kent Dunn, commented, “We are very excited to have on-air the only staff meteorologist in the history of Augusta Radio. Now the CSRA community has the weather information it needs any time - day or night – delivered by a certified Radio meteorologist.” “This is a fantastic opportunity,” responded Smith, “for me both professionally and on a personal level. I look forward to providing weather forecasts to the Augusta community and making our stations the first stop for the latest weather information. We get a taste of all kinds of weather, so things will never get boring!”About Beasley Broadcast Augusta, GA - In the Augusta market, Beasley’s nine radio stations include News-Talk

580 WGAC-AM, Kicks 99 WKXC-FM, 93.9 The Drive WDRR-FM, HD 98.3 Today’s Hit Music WHHD-FM, 102.7

WGUS The Southern Gospel Station WGUS-FM, 1480 WGUS-AM, 95 Rock WCHZ-FM, 93.1 WGAC-FM, and News- Talk-Sports 1630 WRDW-AM. For those who own an HD Radio™ receiver, WKXC-FM, WRDW-AM, WGAC- AM and WHHD-FM all broadcast in crystal clear, CD-quality sound, made possible by HD Radio™ technology. For more information, please visit www.bbgi.com.
